sources.title: Headin' for Trouble (1931) BOB CUSTER
sources.description:
üçïFirst Time on YouTubeüçï
Stars: Bob Custer, Betty Mack, John Ince
Director: J.P. McGowan

Cyclone Crosby arrives at the Palace Saloon seeking work and stops "Boss" Morgan from cheating Tom Courtney during a poker game. Grateful, Tom hires Cyclone to protect his ranch from local cattle rustlers and to prevent him from gambling away the ranch.

TRIVIA: Born Raymond Anthony Glenn on October 18, 1898, in Frankfort, Kentucky, Bob Custer made his film debut in the 1920s and quickly became a popular figure in the B-Western genre. His rugged good looks and ability to perform his stunts helped him stand out among the many cowboy stars of the era.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

metadata.Plot: Cyclone arrives in town just in time to see Slade cheat Courtney at poker. Cyclone takes Courtney's IOU and returns it to him. But Courtney is a compulsive gambler and Slade lures him back for another game, this time winning his ranch. Cyclone once again returns the note but is captured by Slade's men. Slade then heads out to force Courtney to sign over the deed.
metadata.Actors: Bob Custer, Betty Mack, John Ince
